edu.gatech.mbse.transformations.sysml2milp

Class SysML2MILPMappings

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.gatech.mbse.transformations.sysml2milp.SysML2MILPMappings

  • public class SysML2MILPMappings
extends java.lang.Object
    Explicit mappings from SysML to MILP.

    Note that this class should be modified if the full route is taken as described in SysML2MILPTransformation. To do this, the return type would be a MILP model object, and no MILPModel2TextUtils class would be included in the parameter list. The methods are static to emphasize their declarative nature, and to serve as a basis for future development.

    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    Sebastian

    • Method Detail

      • mapSystemUnderDesign

        public static java.lang.String mapSystemUnderDesign(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Classifier systemUnderDesign,
                                    MILPModel2TextUtils milpGen)
        Map a system under design to MILP.

        Note that this is equivalent to the mapping for any UML class, with the difference being that visual output is produced also.

        Parameters:
        systemUnderDesign - The system under design object (a UML class / SysML block).
        milpGen - The MILP code generation object.
        Returns:
        Representation of system under design in MILP code compatible with the specified target MILP environment.

      • mapObjective

        public static java.lang.String mapObjective(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Constraint objective,
                            MILPModel2TextUtils milpGen)
        Map objective from SysML to MILP.
        Parameters:
        objective - A UML Constraint object, stereotyped with "Objective".
        milpGen - The MILP code generation object.
        Returns:
        MILP code compatible with the target environment or an empty string if the specified UML constraint is not an objective.

      • mapResource

        public static java.lang.String mapResource(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Classifier resource,
                           int resourceID,
                           int numInstances,
                           MILPModel2TextUtils milpGen)
        Map a resource type and generate any required instances, and map these, too.
        Parameters:
        resource - The resource type to map
        resourceID - The internal (numeric) ID of this resource (note: in the produced MILP code this is the number following the "M").
        numInstances - The number of possible instances to represent in the MILP.
        milpGen - The MILP code generation object.
        Returns:
        MILP representation of possible instances of the specified type of resource with applicable constraints.

      • mapResourceInstance

        public static java.lang.String mapResourceInstance(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Classifier resource,
                                   int resourceID,
                                   int instanceID,
                                   MILPModel2TextUtils milpGen)
        Create (implicitly) and map a resource instance to MILP code.

        The mapping is similar to that of a UML class (see mapUMLClassifier(Classifier, String, MILPModel2TextUtils)) with the difference being that:
        1) A binary variable is also created to indicate whether the instance is used in the solution (=1) or not (=0)
        2) A constraint is added for this binary variable to break symmetry (i.e., instance 1 must be used before instance 2 is used).

        Parameters:
        resource - The resource type to base the instance on.
        resourceID - The internally used resource ID.
        instanceID - The instance ID (set externally).
        milpGen - The MILP code generation object.
        Returns:
        Representation of resource instance in target MILP syntax.

      • mapFunctionalSpecification

        public static java.lang.String mapFunctionalSpecification(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Activity functionalSpec,
                                          MILPModel2TextUtils milpGen)
        Maps a functional specification.

        In this method, Functions and Working Principles are also mapped. In addition, constraints related to precedence and timing are also generated. Due to their relevance, constraints and variables related to calculating the possible throughput are also added.

        Parameters:
        functionalSpec - The functional specification to map.
        milpGen - The MILP code generation object.
        Returns:
        A representation of the functional specification as a MILP compatible with the desired target MILP environment.

      • mapFunction

        public static java.lang.String mapFunction(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.CallBehaviorAction cba,
                           MILPModel2TextUtils milpGen)
        Maps a function to MILP code.
        Parameters:
        cba - The function to map (a UML CallBehaviorAction object).
        milpGen - The MILP code generation object.
        Returns:
        MILP code representing the particular function or the empty string if the behavior of the CallBehaviorAction is not an instance of a UML Activity.

      • mapWorkingPrincipleInstance

        public static java.lang.String mapWorkingPrincipleInstance(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Activity workingPrinciple,
                                           org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Activity implementedBehavior,
                                           java.lang.String identifier,
                                           MILPModel2TextUtils milpGen)
        Maps a working principle instance to MILP.

        Note that this function should probably be rewritten to make use of more generic mappings such as mapUMLClassifier(Classifier, String, MILPModel2TextUtils). However, then, the fact that pre- and post-conditions are skipped must still be taken into account. Also, constraints defining semantics of the DSEML side constructs must also be taken into account.

        Parameters:
        workingPrinciple - The working principle (as UML Activity) to map.
        implementedBehavior - The function to implement. This is the specified behavior of the CallBehaviorAction that defines the function being translated.
        identifier - Internal identifier for this working principle <-> abstract function combination. Note: in the produced MILP code this is an ID of the form IAxWy.
        milpGen - The MILP code generation object.
        Returns:
        MILP code compatible with the desired target environment describing a particular possible instance of a working principle (for a specific function).

      • mapUMLClassifier

        public static java.lang.String mapUMLClassifier(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Classifier classifier,
                                java.lang.String internalIdentifier,
                                MILPModel2TextUtils milpGen)
        Map a UML class.

        Note that, for all intents and purposes, we are really transforming a "possible" instance. Here, all "slot values" are based on the default values from the underlying type. The solver determines whether or not the particular instance is a part of the solution.

        Parameters:
        classifier - The UML Classifier to map (e.g., UML Class or UML Activity).
        internalIdentifier - The internal identifier associated with this UML element.
        milpGen - The MILP code generation object.
        Returns:
        MILP representation of the UML Classifier and its properties and constraints.

      • mapUMLConstraint

        public static java.lang.String mapUMLConstraint(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Constraint constraint,
                                MILPModel2TextUtils milpGen)
        Maps a UML constraint to MILP code.

        The constraint is mapped after interpreting the expression. This interpretation includes resolving any transformed variables (see MiniOCLInterpretor).

        Parameters:
        constraint - The UML Constraint to map.
        milpGen - The MILP code generation object.
        Returns:
        A MILP representation of the constraint or the empty string if the specification of the constraint is "null", the empty string or the specification object is null.

      • mapUMLProperty

        public static java.lang.String mapUMLProperty(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Property property,
                              java.lang.String ownerIdenfier,
                              MILPModel2TextUtils milpGen)
        Maps a UML property to MILP code.

        Note that special properties (e.g., throughput and productionTime) are treated specially by defining their values to be equal to standard variables (names as defined in StandardVariableNames, declared in MILP code as in SysML2MILPMappingsHelper.declareStandardVariables(MILPModel2TextUtils).

        Parameters:
        property - The property to map.
        ownerIdentifier - The internal identifier used in constructing the variable name.
        milpGen - The MILP code generation object.
        Returns:
        MILP representation of the property or an empty string if the default value is not specified or the property is not recognized as a special (known-to-the- transformation) property.
